config.question: Which of the following describes the impact of the war on women in the American workforce?

choices.content: The concept of “women's jobs” disappeared from the workplace.
Most women filled jobs previously held by male workers who had been drafted.
Housewives in huge numbers entered the labor force in war industries.
The WLB ordered equal pay for equal work for women in war industries.

answer_3.response: Consider This: The war effort brought new opportunities and higher pay to many women workers. In food, airplane, and electrical plants, women made up one-fifth or more of the workforce. As their wages increased, so did their expectations; some became more militant and clashed with male co-workers. See L.O. 24.5 Over Here.
